title: Analysis of Factors Influencing Student Performance in Web-Based Language Learning (WBL): A Project-Based Approach

context.prior_knowledge: Basic proficiency in web-based learning platforms, job-related language literacy (understanding basic grammar/vocabulary), and reading/writing experiences in digital environments
context.additional_context: Requires WBL environment design and performance analysis competency enhancement for current professionals aiming to improve language application skills (writing, presentation, business communication). Focuses on comprehensive evaluation of reading comprehension, listening, and expressive abilities.

learning_goals: Learners explain key factors (motivation, anxiety, attitude) affecting language learning outcomes in WBL environments with empirical data and interpret analysis results using text/audio materials

For evaluating the effectiveness of job-linked WBL programs, learners design one online survey (15–20 items, including a 5-point Likert scale), analyze 50+ collected responses using SPSS, and propose a method to derive effectiveness metrics averaging 4.0+. Language proficiency and communication skill improvement indicators must be included

Learners identify three or more WBL strategy elements reflecting gender differences (e.g., gender-specific vocabulary training, culturally contextualized expression practice), apply them to a project plan template, and submit a final report incorporating team feedback within two weeks
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
